means: 任命( appoint的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Game wardens were appointed to enforce hunting laws in New Hampshire.
sentence.Network_cn: 狩猎监督官被派到新罕布什尔州去执行狩猎法令。

sentence.Network_en: The appointed hour of the ceremony was drawing nearer.
sentence.Network_cn: 既定的典礼时间就快到了。

sentence.Network_en: Inspectors were appointed to inquire into the affairs of the company.
sentence.Network_cn: 督查员受委派调查该公司的事务。

entry.def: If something happens at the appointed time, it happens at the time that was decided in advance.

example.ex: The appointed hour of the ceremony was drawing nearer.
example.tran: 既定的典礼时间就快到了。

means.word_mean: 3. fixed or established especially by order or command;

sentences.sentence: "at the time appointed (or the appointed time")

means.word_mean: 4. provided with furnishing and accessories (especially of a tasteful kind);

auth_sentence.content: Egypt's military-appointed Cabinet held an emergency meeting Monday.
auth_sentence.res_content: Egypt's military-appointed Cabinet held an emergency meeting Monday.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Egypt's military-appointed Cabinet held an emergency meeting Monday.

auth_sentence.content: She was appointed minister in charge of administrative reform.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was appointed minister in charge of administrative reform.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was appointed minister in charge of administrative reform.

auth_sentence.content: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.

Sentence.sentence: Pierre Salinger was appointed senator from California but subsequently lost his first election.
